Major_Arcs.title: Ghost Town Introduction and Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting of Ghost Town, the main characters, and the central conflict concerning the town's impending demolition and its emotional impact.

sub_scenes.title: Setting the Stage
sub_scenes.description: Introduction to the comic title and setting, followed by a saloon scene where initial character dynamics and desires are established.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to the Girl from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Arrival at Ghost Town and Revelation of Demolition Plan
sub_scenes.description: Transition to Ghost Town and the shocking revelation that it is to be demolished for an airport, causing emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Saloon Exit and Ghost Town Ride
Ghost Town's Past and Airport Future
Emotional Argument about Ghost Town's Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Family Business and Personal Turmoil
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Nan's family dynamics, business discussions related to the airport construction, and her personal emotional conflicts, particularly with her father and Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Business and Family Discord
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of business discussions regarding the airport and horses, juxtaposed with family tensions and Nan's escalating argument with her father.

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Counsel and Resolution with Cal
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks comfort and advice from her mother and the maid, leading to her decision to confront Cal and seek clarity in their relationship amidst the unfolding airport project.

narrative_arcs.title: Maid's Pragmatic View on Love and Action

Major_Arcs.title: Relationship Test and Snowstorm Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores the strain on Nan and Cal's relationship due to the airport project and personal misunderstandings, culminating in a severe snowstorm that tests their resilience and brings them closer.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Conflict and Separation
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal's conversation reveals their emotional distance, leading to Cal's departure and Nan's reflective loneliness.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and Understanding

sub_scenes.title: Snowstorm Crisis and Community Response
sub_scenes.description: A sudden and severe snowstorm hits, threatening livestock and livelihoods, but hope arrives in the form of an airplane dropping fodder, bringing community relief and a moment of romance amidst hardship.

narrative_arcs.title: Mr. Wills and Son Assess the Snowstorm's Severity
Grave Concerns about Livestock and Fodder
Confirmation of the Weather's Unprecedented Danger
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst Hardship
Cal's Ominous Reflection on Impending Starvation and Future Uncertainty
Nan's Doubt and Cal's Reassurance in the Face of Crisis
Nan's Mother's Plea for Rest and Hope Amidst Overwhelming Odds
Cal's Restless Night and the Unrelenting Snow
Despair and Weariness in the Face of Endless Winter
Sound of an Airplane and a Glimmer of Hope
Excitement and Realization of Fodder Drop
Conversation on Romance Amidst Crisis and Relief

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Casanova - Introduction of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new location and introduces Chane Benson in a Western town setting, establishing his character through his actions and the reactions of townspeople.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Town Reaction to Chane Benson
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Chane Benson in a town setting, showcasing his confrontational nature and eliciting varied reactions from onlookers.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Chane Benson and a Town Scene
Reactions and Judgments of Bystanders on Chane Benson's Actions
Further Reactions and Cynical Commentary on Chane Benson

sub_scenes.title: Family Concerns and Moral Contrasts
sub_scenes.description: Focus shifts to Jeff and his mother, revealing her concerns about his fascination with gunplay and contrasting Chane Benson with Clyde Surrett as moral figures.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Flashback and Concerns About Jeff
Macho Banter and Violent Undertones between Clyde and Chane

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Worries and Clyde's Reassurance Attempt
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep concern about Jeff's path towards violence, while Clyde attempts to reassure her, leading to a conflict in their approaches to the situation.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Affectionate Agreement and Future Vision
Narrator's Observation of Jeff's Absence and Town Ride
Sally Seeks Advice from Mr. Benson
Mr. Benson's Advice on Violence and Youth

Major_Arcs.title: Newspaper Wars and Town Conflicts
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around a controversial newspaper article and its repercussions in the town, focusing on Sally and Clyde's involvement and the escalating tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Article Fallout and Clyde's Dismissal
sub_scenes.description: Sally reacts angrily to a damaging newspaper article, confronts Clyde (the editor), and seeks guidance from Benson after Clyde dismisses her concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Outrage Over the Article and Initial Talk with Benson
Sally Confronts Clyde, the Editor, About the Article
Clyde's Dismissive Reaction and Sally's Criticism
Sally Seeks Benson's Guidance in Juniper

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Plan and Jeff's Interpretation
sub_scenes.description: Benson outlines his plan to use the press to expose a murderer, while Jeff interprets the article and speculates about Clyde's violent reaction.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Reaction to the Article and Speculation on Clyde's Response

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Misunderstandings
sub_scenes.description: Jeff suggests inviting Chane to dinner, leading to a dinner scene followed by escalating tensions and misinterpretations between Sally, Jeff, and Chane.

narrative_arcs.title: Considering Dinner with Chane and Reflecting on His Character
Post-Dinner Moonlight Conversation and Rising Tension
Immediate Aftermath and Explanations Following the Forced Kiss
Realization of Danger to Clyde and Urgent Need to Go to Town
Jeff's Determined Ride to Save Clyde
Confrontation in Town and Jeff's Intervention
Escalating Tensions and a Challenge to a Fistfight
Anxious Wait in the Clarion Office
Recounting the Night's Events and Newspaper Priority
Praise for Jeff and Clyde's Character and Family Values

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Betsy's Love Story
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to Betsy and Steve's story, focusing on ranch troubles, a potential range war, and the development of a romance amidst conflict and family disapproval.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve and Ranch Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss, setting up ranch troubles and initial tensions with Hank.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the New Boss, Steve Daley
Settling Steve In and Past Doubts
Ranch Troubles and Range War Fear
Trip to Town and Hank's Orders for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: Betsy grapples with firing Hank, realizes her feelings for Steve, and confronts Steve leading to a romantic confession and resolution.

Major_Arcs.title: Range War Escalation and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc escalates the range war conflict and tests Betsy and Steve's relationship as they navigate threats and misunderstandings, leading to a violent confrontation and reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Conflicts and Misunderstandings
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges complains, Hank confronts Steve, and Betsy grapples with her feelings and the escalating violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Hank and Steve's Defense
Justification for Arms and Recall of Ambush
Betsy's Narration of Pursuit and Arrival at Devil's Pass
Confrontation and Capture at Devil's Pass

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie and Fred's Business and Romance Deception
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Carrie and Fred's complex relationship, business deals, and the revelation of Fred's deceptive motives, leading to emotional turmoil and eventual resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Dave and Carrie's Unease and Fred's Ambition
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sternly addresses Dave, followed by a scene introducing Carrie and Fred and setting up Fred's business ambitions and romantic intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Behavior and Ranch Concerns
Discussion of Fred and Differing Opinions
Agreement to Avoid Conflict and Carrie's Reflection
Encounter with Fred Gordon and Ominous Question
Miss Bronson and Mr. Gordon's Conversation about Dave's Feelings
Accusations and Assertions in Carlton's Office
Reflecting on Past Pride and Present Hurt with Fred
Unexpected Encounter and Cold Dismissal in Town
Concern and Defiance in the Buckboard
Father and Dave's Clarification & Carlton's Interjection
Dave's Confession and Carrie's Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Chris and Dirk's Escape and Final Romantic Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chris and Dirk's storyline, focusing on Dirk's injury, their escape, pursuit by the Marshal, and ultimately culminating in a wedding and romantic resolution for Chris.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Arrival and Injury Assessment
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives injured at Chris's place seeking help, and his condition is assessed by a doctor, revealing he has been shot.

narrative_arcs.title: Late Night Visitor and Urgent Plea
Worried Kin and a Father's Decision
Plea for Mercy and a Change of Plans
Duty vs. Love and a Hint of Escape
Decision to Act and Arming Dirk
